Title.En: Technology Transfer and Entrepreneurship with a Focus on Technological Innovation

NoteLiteral.En:
This module is open to bachelor’s students in their final year or master’s students with an interest in entrepreneurship and innovation. No prior knowledge is needed. Check “admission process” for details.

To apply for the course, please provide a motivation letter (approximately ¼ to ½ page). This should include a brief self-description, information about what you are currently studying, your academic background, and whether you have any prior experience in the subject area. If there are specific topics or aspects of the course that interest you, feel free to mention them as well.

Description.En:
**Our Challenge**  
Develop a startup concept that addresses a specific societal problem, such as waste management, affordable housing or renewable energy. The startup should focus on innovative solutions while integrating key considerations such as technology, business models, and stakeholder engagement.

**Expected Impact**  
The solutions proposed by students can serve as actionable ideas for future startups. Additionally, the knowledge imparted in this module equips participants with concrete skills and insights essential for building a startup. This initiative fosters entrepreneurial thinking and problem-solving capabilities, enabling participants to contribute to solving global challenges through innovation.

NoteLiteral.En: By the end of the course learners will be trained how to develop ideas or conclusions that lead to the creation and implementation of innovations or changes.

By the end of the course learners will have an overview and gained first experiences in  processes, techniques and purposes comprised in the first step for developing marketing strategies such as the collection of information about customers and the definition of segments and targets.

By the end of the course the learners have basic knowledge about how to write a viable plan where the position of a business is described within a specific market and the marketing strategy for the following years and how to aim towards best recruiting and retaining talented employees, improving their skills, and incentivising them to achieve high performance.

Title.En: Draw up Marketing and Sales Plan

Title.En: Technology Transfer and Entrepreneurship with a Focus on Technological Innovation
Technology Transfer and Entrepreneurship with a Focus on Technological Innovation

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
**Expectations from Students**

- Collaborate in interdisciplinary teams.
- Devote an average workload of 3-5 hours/week over 5 weeks.
- Present a comprehensive business concept at the end of the module.
- No written assignments are required.

- July 9 10:00 - 11:30 CEST / 9:00 - 10:30 BST

FINAL PRESENTATIONS

July 31 10:00 - 11:30 CEST / 9:00 - 10:30 BST
Empowering Startups to Solve Real-World Problems

Startups are a key driving force in addressing societal and environmental challenges. However, building and scaling a successful startup requires more than innovative ideas — it demands a deep understanding of market needs, technological feasibility, and stakeholder alignment.
This module introduces methods for effective idea development and critical reflection, approaches to market analysis, market potential assessment, and competitor analysis. We will discuss several business models and growth strategies, and their implications for monetization and scalability. The module also covers fundamentals of sales and marketing, talent acquisition, employee incentivization and equity participation, securing venture capital, fostering company culture, operations and management, business plan development, legal foundations, and liability issues.

This mini-module is open to bachelor’s students in their final year or master’s students with an interest in materials science, electronics, or device engineering. No prior knowledge is required.

To apply for the course, please provide a brief self-description (approximately ¼ to ½ page). This should include information about what you are currently studying, your academic background, and whether you have any prior experience in the subject area. If there are specific topics or aspects of the course that interest you, feel free to mention them as well.
